alert.note: Alert for McCormick (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 10:47AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern McDuffie, northwestern Columbia, Lincoln and McCormick Counties through 1130 AM EDT... At 1045 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Washington to 6 miles northwest of Wrightsboro to Warrenton. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Strom Thurmond Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Thomson, McCormick, Lincolnton, Appling, Clarks Hill Recreation Area, Elijah Clark State Park, Mistletoe State Park, Wrightsboro, Hamilton Branch State Park, J. Strom Thurmond Dam, Mccormick County Airport, Thomson-McDuffie County Airport, Lake Strom Thurmond, Bobby Brown State Park, Parksville, Plum Branch, Scott`s Landing and McDuffie Regional Medical Center. This includes Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 167 and 178. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If on or near Lake Strom Thurmond, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
